title: Calculate the EV/EBITDA and EV/Revenue metrics for Adobe (ADBE) in FY 2023. Use the shares outstanding and share price at close from Dec 1, 2023 for the EV calculation. Express the answer using two decimal points of rounding.
description:
1. Calculate the Enterprise Value using EV = market capitalization + total debt - cash and cash equivalents - short-term investments 
 
 2. Extract common shares outstanding = 455M, short-term debt = $0M, long-term debt = $3,634M, cash and cash equivalents = $7,141M, short-term investments = $701M.
 Summary:
 Total debt = $3,634
 Total Cash and Investments = $7,842M
 
 3. Use the closing share price on December 1, 2023 found on a public website like Yahoo Finance = $612.47. Calculate Market capitalization by taking share price x shares outstanding = $278,673.85M
 
 4. Use Step 1 formula to calculate EV = $274,465.85M (278,673.85 + 3,634 - 7141 - 701)
 
 5. Calculate EBITDA using EBITDA = net income + tax + depreciation & amortization – total non-operating income (expense)
 Extract net income = $5,428M, total non-operating income (expense) = $149M, tax = $1,371, depreciation and amortization = $872M. Use the formula to calculate EBITDA = $7,522M. 
 Note that instead of total non-operating income (expense) can also do Interest expense + Investment gains (losses) + other income (expenses) = (113) + 16 + 246 = 149
 
 6. Calculate EV/EBITDA = $274,465.85M/$7,522M = 36.49x 
 
 7. From the 10-K Filing: Extract revenue = $19,409M 
 
 8. Calculate EV/Revenue = $274,465.85M/$19,409M = 14.14x

rubric.criteria: Include common shares outstanding = 455M as input
Include cash and cash equivalents = $7,141M as input
Include total non-operating income (expense) = $149M as input
Include depreciation and amortization = $872M as input
Round EV/EBITDA to two decimal points = 36.49x
Round EV/Revenue to two decimal points = 14.14x
Market Capitalization calculated as share price x shares outstanding = $278,673.85M
